comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Wife of (Louis) Aston Knight (1873–1948), a French-born American artist noted for his paintings of landscapes (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_Aston_Knight). Aston's father, a painter as well, was already named Ridgway, see The Salt Lake tribune., February 12, 1911, Page 19 with a extensive article about the Knight family. According to wikipedia, she was Caroline Ridgeway Brewster. She had two sons, Ridgway Brewster Knight and George William Knight, and a daughter, Diane Knight Todd. records.ancestry.com/Caroline_Ridgway_Brewster_records.as... says she was Caroline Ridgway Brewster, born in Rochester, New York, USA on 21 Sep 1882 to Elisha Franklin Brewster and Sarah Ridgway Macy and had 4 children. She passed away on 26 Jun 1959. Ridgway Brewster Knight was born in Paris, France on 12 Jun 1911 and died on 14 Aug 2001 in Le Touquet, France (records.ancestry.com/Ridgway_Brewster_Knight_records.ashx...)

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: The New York Herald ran an almost identical picture of their arrival from France on 12/15/1915 aboard the SS Espagne of the French Line. fultonhistory.com/Newspaper%2014/New%20York%20NY%20Herald...
